Translated by Mr. Gafo Hiribae Suleiman & Mr. Kenneth Yakko Galana
Vya lombolo MOJA d’oku ambadyo kwafed’ekanani umanye  kuhusu e bifa ambayo virusi vya ug’onjo wa korona
eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

pkb: VYADDACH’AA
Miyomoni
Mpuyani
Machoni
Yakungia amwo
Muntu aiye fayuma
Muntu mug’onjo
E virusi avyo vyaddach’aa kona e mahwente yano
Kaiya kuwe. Mita mbili zakuwezesha usepata mahwente makuyu
eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.

pkb: Mita mbili
Kohoo!
Ddubha kona kuona muntu kakololani/kabigani myasa/ni mug’onjo unaweza ukaamua ku:
eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

pkb: Waphe kib’aiko kya kukingiliza e mpuya ne miyomo. Waweza kukolola au kubiga myasa mude mwe kib’aiko na wawakinge wade wotte waiyo hafuphi nao
eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby

pkb: Asantta *vittambaa vya kubigia myasa *
AU
Phangine sapha mug’onjo, kajikingani b’asi.
eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

pkb: Wantu ambao wakiziywa e ug’onjo ao waweza kuseyagiza d’alili zidezonchi, amo amale waweza kukizia wantu wangine.
eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

pkb: Na kwa j’umula, ni vijure zaid’i kujifyula na ttutta ya wantu, koro nkuji kwamba aiye mug’onjo ni ga.
eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

pkb: Vijihi vya kuyavia uchafu wa magego
Muntu aiye fayuma
Nkanda za g’ari ya moshi
Vifod’onko ambavyo vyaminywa ili wantu waphae juyu na ngazi ya sitima
Vikarattasi vya kuphangusia mikono
Vikombe
Visaga vyatumia mitandao
Na hatta battini ye kib’aiko kyako kye uso
eng: & even on the outside of your face mask

pkb: Nguzo za ngazi kona kwaphayani d’arini
Kifaa kiikyo bifa ya mpanya kyatumika kwa kompyuta
Kalamu
Piki za midyango
E mikono yao
Cha javyavyo, saa zingine mahe ya muntu mug’onjo yaweza kufikia  visaga vingine…
eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

pkb: mwaweza kuhenda wag’onjo nyotte
au e uso wa yude umujamiyeo
ujiphokoche e macho
Na kona kuddaba kisaga kimoja kahi ya avyo b’ila ya kumanya, kisa ujiddabe e uso,
eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

pkb: na e ngia njure zaid’i ya kuvinusa e virusi avyo ni kuvikosa uviyavye na sab’uni, ddawa ya kuyaga viini vya mag’onjo au utumie ddawa iiyo na tembo.
eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

pkb: Virusi vya uwezo wa kukaya rigo juyu ya visaga kwa masaa kachuchu
eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

pkb: Sab’uni
Ndo maana ni vijure pia kuyuba e maag’izo yano
eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these

pkb: Kosa na sab’uni mupaka phano
eng: wash with soap up to here

pkb: Kikorhokorho
Manya usejiddaba e uso. (Au uso wa yudeywonchi.) Kona ni haddi uuddabe, ikose nguzi e mikono yako na sab’uni, ikose na kuigagalia.
eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

pkb: Mala ya kwamba unaweza ukakwimba e wiya ude wa “Mwana Mujongosi” mara mbili
eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice

pkb: mude nyayani
kwa sekunde miongo miwili
Kahi ye mad’oe
Kosa e mongo we maganja yako
eng: wash the back of your hands

pkb: Kukosa na kugagalia imaanisha nkega?
Kona kuddaba, sijoj’ali. Awe kosa e mikono yako na sab’uni b’aad’a ya kuhenda ja avyo.
eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

pkb: Pia, manya kuddaba e battini ye kibaiko kyako kona unad’una.
eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

pkb: mahwente
Viini vya bakiteria ambavyo vyasab’ab’isha mag’onjo vyamea kizimu ye kib’aiko kyako kona kukivwaya kwa mud’a mulela sana
eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

pkb: Fattula e vib’aiko kona vikaya bifa zuka. Manya kuvivwaya zaid’i ya siku moja!
eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

pkb: Tumia kij’iko kya kumolea vintu
Mwana
Baba
Mama
Kila mumoja awe na tauli yakwe
Manya kudya sahani moja na muntu, au kutumia phamojani visaga vya jikoni, au kutumia tauli phamoja.
eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

pkb: Kuwezi kujiddaba e uso ne kikorhokorho kyako hatta kud’ema
eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

pkb: Funga na kufunguya midyango ne vikorhokorho au vitturo vyako b’ad’ili ye mikono, kona yawezekana.
eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

pkb: Nyumbani
Na b’aad’a ya kuyawa na bia ya wantu wangine
eng: and after being out in the public

pkb: Kab’ula nkujanadya
Kosa e mikono yako na sab’uni saa zo badda chwe…
eng: Always wash your hands with soap…

pkb: Na mwiso,
Kila muntu akae salama!
Soma e vitab’u avyo upate maelezo zaid’i!
eng: Read the articles for more tips!
